ingredients: 2 cups and a handful Semi-sweet chocolate chips
6/8 of an inch less than a cup Granulated sugar
instructions: Add 2 sticks of refrigerated butter to the kitchen Aid mixer bowl and beat on low until it's just a little mushed.  Roughly 30 sec.
Add brown sugar and white sugar, then cover with hands while beating on high until med/small clumps form.
Take the bowl out from under the kitchen aid and using a rice spoon/paddle mash the clumps of butter against the side of the bowl until most of them are broken up and gone.
Add eggs, baking soda, salt, and vanilla then mix. NOTE: the less mixing the better because if the dough gets too warm that can hinder how well the cookies bake.
Add oats and chocolate chips then mix.
Refrigerate for an hour or 2 but NOT overnight!
Scoop onto baking stone or greased cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 min or to your preference.
